description.narrative: Conciliation Resources (CR) is a global peace building oragnisation with programs in a number of conflict affected countries. In addition to the concrete work in peace processes CR has initiatives on advocacy and method development from comparative peace processes, which is distributed throughout the peace building community. Sida contributes with a core support to CR.

Conciliation Resources (CR) är en global fredsbyggande organisation med verksamhet i flertalet konfliktdrabbade länder. Utöver konkret arbete med fredsprocess arbetar CR med metodutveckling och påverkansarbete globalt där lärande från fredsprocesser sprids och utvecklas. Sida bidrar med ett kärnstöd till CR.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: During 2015, Conciliation Resources continued to support peacebuilding in eight regional areas across five continents. In West Africa, Conciliation Resources brought together security and government officials from Liberia and Côte d'Ivoire to discuss ongoing cross border tension for the first time, leading to joint and individual country commitments for change (the so called "Accra Declaration"). With the resumption of the official India-Pakistan dialogue, Conciliation Resources together with its local partners facilitated a high-level dialogue process meeting while continuing to support trade across the Line of Control. In Mindanao in the Philippines, Conciliation Resources' local partners have contributed to moving the issue of women's participation in the peace process from a rather marginalised question to an issue that is widely acknowledged as central and was gaining ground, as the Congress included provisions that would defend the rights of women and of indigenous people in the draft legislation to implement the 2014 peace agreement. These are a few examples of programme achievements. In advocay on the global level, Conciliation Resources contributed to taking stock of the 15 years of work on women, peace and security since the adoption of UNSCR 1325. The Gender and Conflict Analysis Toolkit for Peacebuilders that was published that year was disseminated widely. The organisation has also highlighted issues around local engagement with armed groups by peacebuilders (also the theme of an Accord Insight issues published during the year).
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
